item.title: A2 (second year) - Powerpoints
item.description: Overview Below you will find links to the PowerPoints and associated resources that I use to deliver the OCR A2 Level Computer Science Course. Cheat Sheets Cheat Sheets H446/01 - Paper 1 OOP for Projects Memory Von Newmann RISC v CISC GPU Processing Textbook Section 1 End OS and CPU Scheduling Compilers Assemblers Open Source Linkers and Loaders Binary Arithmetic Software Methodologies Sorting Algorithms Programming Paradigms Databases Assembly and LMC Cryptographic Hash Function HTML and CSS Search Engines Boolean Logic Networks Adders and Flip Flops Data Storage Final Bits of Paper 1 Laws and Ethics H446/02 - Paper 2 Abstraction and Decomposition Thinking Procedurally Problem Recognition Programming Fundamentals Pathfinding Revision Both Papers Revision - Checklist

item.title: AS (year 1) - Powerpoints
item.description: Overview Below you will find links to the PowerPoints and associated resources that I use to deliver the OCR AS Level Computer Science Course. H046/01 - Paper 1 Pseudocode Memory Programming (you will need some winforms experience for this one) RISC v CISC and Von Newmann v Harvard Evolution:- Please don’t worry about missing numbers, this has happened over time. OS and CPU Scheduling Distributed, Embedded, Etc… OS Compilers, Assemblers and Open Source Binary Arithmetic Floating Point and HEX Development Methodologies More evolution:- After changing textbooks I altered the order of the course, so some of the numbering goes a bit odd, lesson 12b has nothing to do with lesson 12 but they are delivered in that order.

item.title: Tutorial 1 - Access an API with Winforms
item.description: Overview This tutorial will enable you to access data from an API in winform. It is a good place to start as you don’t need to learn MVC you can do everything you need within a familiar WinForms environment. Simply use the document below as a self-guided classroom / training room resource. It has been written in MS Word so you can use it as is, or you can edit as appropriate.

item.title: Tutorial 2 - Car Data API in ASP/MVC
item.description: Overview This tutorial will enable you to make a start building MVC (Model View Controller) apps. MVC uses a web front end. It is far more complex than winforms but the end result is more modern and much more attractive. This app requires you to create an account with: UK Vehicle Data, this can take up to two days to be authorised. Create your account as soon as you read this and come back to the tutorial once you have access.

item.title: Tutorial 3 - MVC with Spotify data
item.description: Overview This tutorial will enable you to access data from Spotify using MVC. This is a complex tutorial and will take some time to complete. This app requires you to create an account with: Spotify Developer. Create your account as soon as you read this and complete the tutorial once you have access. Simply use the document below as a self-guided classroom / training room resource. It has been written in MS Word so you can use it as is, or you can edit as appropriate.

item.title: WinForms - Getting Started
item.description: Winforms - What is it? Winforms projects are a simple way to get started with C# programming. They combine a simple front end (screen) with a closely linked backend (code). Below is a very short overview of how to build a simple winforms project using C#. For guidance with a bit more clarity follow this link to my winforms resources link here How to work with Winforms (a short guide) You’ll need some free software, MS Visual Studio Community Edition, avaliable here –> Download Visual Studio.
